txt.en: Use Quickslot Bars to gain instant access to actions and equipment. Drag from your skills panel, character panel, or inventory.
The Quests/Deeds Tracker allows you to display the current objectives of up to five quests or deeds at any given time.
Want to create and choose an outfit? Use the inventory and outfit buttons on Cosmetic Outfits tab on the Character panel (C).
Want to customize your appearance? Use the show/hide toggles next to the equipment slots on the Character tab (C).
Press 'O' to display the Social Panel, which shows information about your current Fellowship, Kinship, and Friends list.
You can examine inventory items, other players, enemies, and NPCs by holding your cursor over the target.
Press 'C' to display the Character Journal, where you can view statistics, equipped items, and skills.
After earning a new level, be sure to check for new abilities or Trait Points (K) (J).
Left-click on another player, NPC, or enemy to see its name and vital statistics.
Press the 'Backspace' key to select the nearest target.
Any player or fellowship to engage a monster will get credit for defeating it.
Press the 'M' key to open the map to show the region or city you are currently in.
Press the 'I' key to toggle your inventory.
New quests can be automatically added to your quest tracker by choosing the toggle in the options panel.
You can purchase the Riding Trait from the LOTRO Store or Mithril vendors.
When selling items to a vendor, only unequipped items will be shown in the 'Sell' window.
You can change the action for each of the toolbar buttons on your main bar in the Options panel.
'Ctrl' + 'O' will bring up the Options panel.
Toggle 'Always accept automatic quests' in the UI Settings of the Options panel to accept all offered remotely bestowed quests.
Use the HELP option on the System menu to access FAQs, request support, or file a bug (F7).
Use the 'Tab' key to cycle through nearby targets.
Quests that are recommended for a Fellowship are indicated in your journal with a group icon.
There are many exclusive items available from the LOTRO Store.
Press the spacebar to make your character jump up in the air.
Check the LOTRO Store for weekly sales on specific items.
To attack a targeted enemy, right-click it, double-click it, press '`', or use any damaging attack skill.
Mounts are purchaseable skills that allow you to summon a unique mount for your characters.
Click on the ring next to a quest in the quest tracker to quickly bring up that quest in your quest journal.
Quests are gained by talking to NPCs with golden ring icons above their heads.
Right-click on the ring next to a quest in the quest tracker to bring up quest tracker options. Find quests near your current location or select a quest for quest guide guidance.
Some NPCs have silver ring icons, rather than gold. Try talking to them again after gaining a couple more levels.
Visit Lalia's Market near the Boar Fountain in Bree to purchase select cosmetic clothing items and sets.
Control availability, visibility, and arrangement of quickslot bars in the Options Panel (CTRL-O).
Right-click on a ring in the quest tracker and pick 'Find Others On Quest' to help find people working on that quest.
Vault-keepers grant access to your bank, where you can store up to 30 items. Additional storage space can also be purchased.
'Ctrl + left-click' any item in inventory, on a vendor, or linked in chat to try it on in the Dressing Room.
You can buy, sell, and repair items with many vendors in Middle-earth by double-clicking them.
Move using your mouse by holding down both mouse buttons.
Use 'Del' to select the nearest item, and 'U' to use it.
Lockboxes contain gear, cosmetics, and other useful items. Get keys from the LOTRO Store to open them.
'J' will open the Trait Tree Panel, where you can choose your class path and allocate trait points for powers, bonuses, and skills.
'Esc' will close all open panels including quest dialogs or open the system menu if nothing else is open.
You can drag skills from your skills panel, emotes from the emote collections panel, and usable items from your inventory or character sheet to any quickslot
Use 'Del' to select the nearest item, 'F10' the nearest NPC, and 'F8' your nearest fellow.
You can toggle floating player, NPC, and item names by pressing the 'N' key.
